details.title: Some Aging Properties of the Residual Life of<tex>$k$</tex>-out-of-<tex>$n$</tex>Systems

authors.affiliation: Sch. of Math. & Stat., Lanzhou Univ.

p: Xiaohu Li is a chief professor at the School of Mathematics and Statistics, Lanzhou University. He obtained his PhD in 2000 at Lanzhou University. His research interests include aging property, stochastic order, sample spacing, $k$-out-of-$n$ structure, and shock models. He has conducted three research projects supported by National Natural Science Foundation China, and has published 30 referred journal papers on applied probability and statistics.

authors.name: X. Li

p: Peng Zhao is a PhD student at the School of Mathematics and Statistics, Lanzhou University. His research interests include $k$-out-of-$n$ structures and shock models etc.

details.abstract: The k-out-of-n structure is a very popular type of redundancy in fault-tolerant systems. It has been applied in industrial, and military systems. In this paper, we investigate the general residual life (GRL) of a (n-k+1)-out-of-n system with i.i.d. components, given that the total number of the failures of components is less than l-1(1lesl<klesn) at time tges0. It is shown that the GRL is decreasing in l in terms of the likelihood ratio order; Behavior of IFR, and NBU of life distributions are discussed in terms of the monotonicity of GRL. Finally, comparison of the GRL of two (n-k+1)-out-of-n systems are conducted given that the lifetime of their components are assumed to be ordered in the hazard rate order

references.title:
A
note on the mean residual life function of a parallel system
references.text: M. Asadi, I. Bairamov, "A note on the mean residual life function of a parallel system", Communications in Statistics-Theory and Methods, vol. 34, pp. 475-484, 2005.

references.title:
A residual life function of a system having parallel or
series structures

context.text: For example, Bairamov [2] investigated \$E(X_{n, n}-t \vert X_{1, n}>t)\$ of a parallel system given no failure before time \$t\geq 0\$.

references.text: I. Bairamov, M. Ahsanullah, I. Akhundov, "A residual life function of a system having parallel or series structures", Journal of Statistical Theory and Applications, vol. 1, pp. 119-132, 2002.

references.title: Statistical Theory of Reliability and Life Testing: Probability Models

context.text: For more details, readers can refer to Barlow & Proschan [3], Langberg [9], Hendi [7], Chen [5], Belzunce [4], Li [12], Pellerey & Petakos [14], Li & Kochar [11], Franco [6], Li & Zuo [13], and Li & Chen [10].
For more details on the results to be summarized here, see Barlow & Proschan [3].

references.text: R. E. Barlow, F. Proschan, Statistical Theory of Reliability and Life Testing: Probability Models, 1975, Silver Spring.

formation of parallel systems

context.text: For more details, readers can refer to Barlow & Proschan [3], Langberg [9], Hendi [7], Chen [5], Belzunce [4], Li [12], Pellerey & Petakos [14], Li & Kochar [11], Franco [6], Li & Zuo [13], and Li & Chen [10].

links.abstract: The paper by M.I. Hendi et al. (see J. Appl. Probability, vol.30, p.975-8) proves that the family of new better than used in convex order (NBUC) distributions is closed under the formation of parallel systems with i.i.d components. This paper proves, through a simple argument based on stochastic orders, that this property also holds for s-independent but not identically distributed components. The proof presented here, with minor modifications, also provides both the proof of the closure under f...

references.text: F. Pellerey, K. Petakos, "On closure property of the NBUC class under formation of parallel systems", IEEE Transactions on Reliability, vol. 51, pp. 452-454, 2002.
